The text mentions several diploma programs offered at the School of Hospitality and Tourism Management of the college, including Tourism and Hospitality Management (H130), Food and Beverage Management-Restaurant Management (H132), Hospitality-Hotel Operations Management (H133), and Event Planning (H141). The students who complete a certificate are qualified to apply for these programs with met admission requirements and available space. The required courses for each semester are listed, such as Principles of Hospitality and Tourism Management (HOST 1085), Global Accommodation Industry (HOST 1171), Introduction to Wines and Beverages (HOST 1172), Leading, Following and Speaking with Confidence (COMM 1146), and Career Preparation (HOST 1175). Some courses are seven-week courses (*), and some students may need to take Introduction to College Communication (COMM 1000) before progressing to COMM 2000. The graduate of the program is expected to demonstrate abilities in hospitality management, communication, law, accounting, human resources management, sustainability, restaurant service, events planning, and marketing. Some courses require online certificates or weekend courses for completion.

Program Learning Outcomes:
- Provide hospitality service in a professional manner to increase customer satisfaction
- Identify and describe various sectors of the Canadian tourism industry
- Use basic math and monetary calculations for daily hospitality operations
- Assist in marketing and sales of small- and medium-sized hospitality businesses
- Comply with health and safety regulations, legislation and procedures related to the hospitality industry
- Plan and implement personal and professional development strategies related to the hospitality industry
- Use current technologies, systems and computer applications for hospitality operations
- Perform as an entry-level accommodation operations team member in front and back-of-the-house positions
- Perform as an entry-level food and beverage team member in front and back-of-the-house positions

Tuition & Fees:
[Domestic Students]
- Tuition: $4,910.00 * for first two semesters of programs starting Fall 2023
- Additional Costs: $575 for textbooks, manuals, etc (fees are subject to change)
- Included in material fees is a uniform; black pants, grey Oxford shirt and a bib apron

[International Students]
- Visit the International Fees and Related Costs page for more information.

[Financial Assistance]
- This program is approved for OSAP funding, provided the applicant meets OSAP eligibility criteria.

* What responsibilities does an entry-level food and beverage team member have in front-and back-of-the-house positions?

context:
Program Learning Outcomes:
- Provide hospitality service in a professional manner to increase customer satisfaction
- Identify and describe various sectors of the Canadian tourism industry
- Use basic math and monetary calculations for daily hospitality operations
- Assist in marketing and sales of small- and medium-sized hospitality businesses
- Comply with health and safety regulations, legislation and procedures related to the hospitality industry
- Plan and implement personal and professional development strategies related to the hospitality industry
- Use current technologies, systems and computer applications for hospitality operations
- Perform as an entry-level accommodation operations team member in front and back-of-the-house positions
- Perform as an entry-level food and beverage team member in front and back-of-the-house positions

Tuition & Fees:
[Domestic Students]
- Tuition: $4,910.00 * for first two semesters of programs starting Fall 2023
- Additional Costs: $575 for textbooks, manuals, etc (fees are subject to change)
- Included in material fees is a uniform; black pants, grey Oxford shirt and a bib apron

[International Students]
- Visit the International Fees and Related Costs page for more information.

[Financial Assistance]
- This program is approved for OSAP funding, provided the applicant meets OSAP eligibility criteria.

,
* Is this program eligible for OSAP funding?

OSAP funding is provided to applicants who meet OSAP eligibility criteria. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.

Admission Requirements:
- Ontario Secondary School Diploma (OSSD) or equivalent
- Grade 12 English (C or U)
- Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English OR consider upgrading to achieve the credit(s) needed in English.

Course Exemptions:
- College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions. More information can be found on the transfer guide.

International Students:
- Visit the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.

Domestic Students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
International Students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.

Contact Us:
- For inquiries about domestic admission requirements, deadlines or the admissions process, contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions web page.
- For inquiries about OSAP, bursaries, scholarships, and other financial inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid web page.
- For general School of Hospitality and Tourism Management–related inquiries, contact chcastudentsupport@georgebrown.ca.
- Contact Centre: 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002.
- International recruitment representatives can be contacted by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page.

Visit Our Campus:
- Information sessions are available for those thinking about attending George Brown. The Hospitality Services program is taught at the St. James Campus located at 200 King St. E., Toronto, Ontario. Sign up for an information session.

Campus location: 200 King St. E., Toronto, Ontario
Programs offered: Tourism and Hospitality Management (H130), Hospitality – Hotel Operations Management (H133), Event Planning (H141)
Ways to explore the campus: Information session, general campus tour, book resources for application process
Contact information: Book campus tour, get answers to questions, sign up to receive tailored resources, email communications from George Brown College.
